metadata.title: CVE-2018-6412 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
In the function sbusfb_ioctl_helper() in drivers/video/fbdev/sbuslib.c inthe Linux kernel through 4.15, an integer signedness error allows arbitraryinformation leakage for the FBIOPUTCMAP_SPARC and FBIOGETCMAP_SPARCcommands.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6412` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1031-aws - 4.15.0-1031.33~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1008-oracle - 4.15.0-1008.10~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.33~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1008.10~16.04.1').
